page.title: 07EDUCATION
page.content: Children in this area attend the 200+ pupil Chequer Mead County Primary School run by West Sussex County Councilfrom its area office at Crawley. Chequer Mead was East grinsteads first school and has no grassed playground only a tarmaced area big enough for a net ball court plus a learner size swimming pool. This part of East Grinstead has expanded in the last 5 years and there is now a shortage of primary school places. The council is considering building a larger school or alternatively taking over the East Grinstead youth club's and adult education buildings on the Chequer Mead site and converting them to classrooms. A decision should be made in Autumn 1985.
